snippet: The officials detailed how leaders of the Coalition for Clean and Fair Elections have received threats because of a campaign calling for reforms to Malaysia’s election system.
abstract: United Nations envoys urge the Malaysian government to protect political activists from harassment and to withdraw a civil suit it filed against the leaders of the Coalition for Clean and Fair Elections; say the group's leaders, including chairwoman Ambiga Sreenevasan, have been receiving death threats because of their political activities.
lead_paragraph: The officials detailed how leaders of the Coalition for Clean and Fair Elections have received threats because of a campaign calling for reforms to Malaysia’s election system.

headline.seo: U.N. Envoys Ask Malaysia to Protect Activists
headline.main: U.N. Envoys Ask Malaysia to Protect Activists
headline.print_headline: Malaysia: Government Urged To Protect Political Activists
